topic.title: HP Helion 1.2 Development Platform: Release Notes for HP Helion Development Platform 1.2

body.p: The following release notes are for the HP Helion Development Platform 1.3 released in August 2015. We hope you enjoy the release!

section.title: Release Notes
section.p: The following features have been changed in HP Helion Development Platform 1.3:

dlentry.dd: Deploying Docker Images as apps provides an alternative to the usual method of application deployment, which is driven by buildpacks. Administrators control user permissions and which registries and images are allowed. Local ALS caching registry servers share Docker image layers to improve deployment efficiency.
The buildpacks have all been updated, including Ruby (2.1.5) and Docker (1.5).
This release includes a merge from Cloud Foundry v205.
More fine-grained Admin permission controls are now available.

UTM (Unified Threat Management) or Gateway firewalls may interfere with upgrades, patches, or normal application staging if they are configured to inspect all HTTP(S) traffic between ALS nodes and upstream package repositories. See the full documentation for a detailed explanation and suggested solutions.

The optional Harbor TCP/UDP port service must be set up on a node with a public network interface if you wish to enable port forwarding for user applications. The security group or firewall settings for this node should make the configured port range accessible publicly.

section.p: The following features have been changed in HP Helion Development Platform 1.2:

dlentry.dt: Develop, deploy, and manage cloud-native .NET applications
dlentry.dd: HP is the only vendor to offer this functionality in today's Cloud Foundry technology v2, which is a key part of HP Helion Development Platform. We offer Windows support by providing the ability to host Windows applications on a Windows DEA (Droplet Execution Agent) with a "bring your own Windows license" model.

dlentry.dt: Microsoft SQL Server integration available as an application service
dlentry.dd: Developers can bind their applications to a Microsoft SQL Server database via the service model and enable self-service dispensing of database resources - eliminating the need for administrative or operator intervention.

dlentry.dt: Complete set of .NET development tools and SDKs
dlentry.dd: The addition of the Visual Studio Cloud Foundry Explorer and MS Build tasks enable the .NET enterprise developer to deploy and manage their application directly from the favorite development IDE, command line environment or build agent.

dlentry.dt: Horizon panel updates for IT operations
dlentry.dd: Administrators can now run even more operations from the HP Helion OpenStack Horizon management console, including renaming clusters, adding DEA nodes, adding roles, proxy support and DNS suffixes.

dlentry.dt: When creating a new database, cf-mgmt create cluster or add-service command fails.
dlentry.dd: This issue applies to HP Helion Public Cloud only. When using cf-mgmt create cluster or add-service commands to create a new database, the operation fails. There is no workaround at this time.

dlentry.dt: Windows DEA and SQL Server services are not available through the ALS Management Console
dlentry.dd: Although it appears that you can complete these tasks using the ALS Management Console, you must use the cf-mgmt tool or the Horizon console to add Windows DEA Nodes and SQL Server services.

dlentry.dt: Windows Nodes do not support Linux services
dlentry.dd: Linux services - for example, redis or mySQL - can not be added to Windows nodes.
